items.title: Click here to go back to GSG English Home
items.description: You are here: GSG English Home > Grammar Central

items.content:
Period 1

Recap
Present simple I walk to school everyday.
Present continuous I am walking to school right now.
Past simple Yesterday, I went to school.
Present perfect I have been to France twice this year.
Past continuous I was walking down the street when I heard the alarm.
Irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden) sing - sang - sung

New
Present continuous for irritation I don't like them because they are always complaining.
Pitfalls their - they're - there
Prepositions Across the street, over the phone, by the time

Period 2

New
To-infinitive vs gerund I would love to cook you something nice.
Cooking is a hobby of mine.
If-sentences for unlikely events (second conditional)

If I were a king, I would build palaces everywhere.
Should(n't) + infinitive vs shouldn't have + past participle

You should be nicer to me next time.
You should have been nice to me yesterday.
Will be able to vs might be able to

I will be able to to help you this afternoon.
I might be able to fix that problem.

Period 3

Recap
Past simple Yesterday, I went to school.

New
Passive A thief stole my bike. > My bike was stolen (by a thief).
Possession Lisa's sister. My parents' car. President of the United States.
Past perfect Mr Smith realized that he had left his laptop at work.
Some, any, no and compound words Would you like some coffee, sir? I can't find my coat anywhere.

Period 4

Recap
Present simple I walk to school every day.
Present continuous I am walking to school right now.
Will vs going to (future tenses)

I will see you tomorrow.
I am going to buy a house in Spain.

New
What vs which What is your favourite colour?
Which of these colours do you prefer?
Indirect speech Tim: I love you Lisa! > Tim said he loved me!
If-sentences for facts (zero conditional) If you cook water, it boils at a hundred degrees.
Future tenses

I will be bathing in the sun by then.
The train leaves at 1:05 PM.
I am having a picnic with Tim and Lisa this afternoon.
I will see you tomorrow.
I am going to buy a house in Spain.

Period 5

Recap
If-sentences for facts (zero conditional) If you cook water, it boils at a hundred degrees.
If-sentences for unlikely events (second conditional) If I were a king, I would build palaces everywhere.
Present perfect I have been to France twice this year.

New
If-sentences for likely events (first conditional) If I have time this afternoon, I wil help you with your homework.
Present perfect continuous I have been waiting for twenty-five minutes. Where are you?!
Comparisons (comparatives and superlatives) smart - smarter - smartest

Ex. 11

items.content:
Many of these exercises will focus on the past perfect AND the past simple. This is because they naturally occur together in one sentences.

If you want more practice with the difference or combination between the past perfect and the past simple, use the exercises in the next menu (past perfect vs past simple). It is important to practise them in combination with one another.
Check out the instructions (videos / written instructions) for each of the future forms and then to these exercises.

Should(n't) + inf. / Shouldn't have + past part.

items.title: Ex. 1 - should have + past participle
items.description: Deze oefening gebruik je om te leren hoe je iemand afrekent op iets wat al gebeurd is.

items.title: Ex. 2 - should + infinitive
items.description: Deze oefening gebruik je om te leren hoe je iemand advies geeft.
